lead_paragraph: A bill would require the Landmarks Preservation Commission to vote a proposed landmark up or down within a year; some preservationists call the time limit too short.

headline.print_headline: Bill to Alter New York’s Landmarks Law Would Set Time Limit on Approvals
headline.main: Council Considers Big Changes in How New York Approves Landmarks

snippet: A bill would require the Landmarks Preservation Commission to vote a proposed landmark up or down within a year; some preservationists call the time limit too short.
abstract: New York City Council is resuming fight for changes to city's Landmarks Law, with intention of streamlining and expanding process of designating landmarks; Council's decision to revisit changes has brought criticism from preservationists and from Landmarks Preservation Commission itself, which calls proposed amendments overreaching.
